revised_title: James Theobald: A Merchant and Natural Historian
tldr: The article discusses the life and contributions of James Theobald, a merchant and natural historian who was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1725. Theobald was involved in the timber trade and played a significant role in the work of the Royal Society's Repository Committees. He had connections with several Norwegian correspondents and contributed to the understanding of Scandinavian natural history and antiquities. Theobald was an active member of the Royal Society, making numerous introductions and transmitting letters, objects, and information.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History
